page.title: 02Religion:Totteridge and Penn
page.content: There are nine{churches}in the area . Four were built in this century, the rest are over 100 years old. The oldest is{Penn Parish church}which was built in{1077}using local flint, clunch,{Roman}bricks and even{Pre- {historic stones.}It stands{600 feet {above sea level}and the view from the top of the{bell tower}can include {twelve counties.}On the tower is a {unique, blue clockface.}It has Roman numerals and only one hand which tells the time. The Baptism font is made of lead. It is very rare because of it's unusual shape. One of the newest churches is{St. Andrews}in Hatter's Lane. It is built from brick and concrete and the church is now being extended. A lot of community work is done there. Some pensioners who meet at the church were at{St. Andrew's first service 25 years ago.
